Making The Remix: Slippery friction (Tryin' Mix) with Toucon - Lorenzo's Music Podcast

November 29, 2024 by Tom Ray

Listen to the song "Slippery friction (Tryin' Mix)" on our album Lorenzo's Remixes, Volume 1

Making Beats: The Story Behind "Slippery friction (Tryin' Mix)" for Lorenzo's Remixes Vol. 1

Subscribe to the podcast on: Spotify | Apple Podcasts | YouTube Podcasts | RSS

In this episode, I talk with Toucon (aka Connor Lipke) a producer and musician. He tells me the story behind the beat he created for the remix of our song "Slippery friction" on our EP Lorenzo's Remixes, Volume 1. 

He reveals how he uses tools like FL Studio and Serum VST to structure his beats with a MIDI keyboard and an electronic drum kit.

Toucon explains his process of layering synths and beats, often starting with a simple melody and building complexity from there. He shares insights into his workflow, including how he organizes and sells his beats through platforms like BeatStars.

Links

Toucon on Spotify - https://open.spotify.com/artist/5m9Arsu1Lxf5DPPGDYL7Ww

Toucon on Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/touconofficial

Listen to the Remix album!

Blue water friction (Live Music Video)

November 13, 2024 by Tom Ray

Stream "Blue water friction" on:

  • Spotify
  • Apple Music
  • YouTube Music
  • Amazon Music
  • Bandcamp

Live music video for "Blue water friction" by Lorenzo's Music

"Blue Water Friction" by Lorenzo's Music is a throwback to the new wave reggae sound of the 80s, reminiscent of early Joe Jackson or The English Beat. This track, the 5th for a film soundtrack, features echo-y drums, sax riffs, and distinctive guitar sounds.

We recorded this video of the song live from our recording studio using, Ardour, Doidcam, OBS, Kdenlive, and Ubuntu Studio a computer operating system for musicians and artists.

music-video videospage Blue water friction live-video

Making The Remix: Rainy day friction (Nicholas Burgess Mix) with Nicholas Burgess

November 08, 2024 by Tom Ray

Listen to the song "Rainy day friction (Nicholas Burgess Mix)" on our album Lorenzo's Remixes, Volume 1

The Art of Remixing: Behind the Scenes of "Rainy day friction (Nicholas Burgess Mix)"

Subscribe to the show on: Spotify | Apple Podcasts | YouTube Podcasts | RSS

In this episode, I talk with musician Nicholas Burgess who shares his creative process behind the remix of our song "Rainy Day Friction," a track featured on the recently released EP "Lorenzo's Remixes Volume 1." 

Nicholas describes his approach to remixing as treating the project as if it were his own song. He begins by listening to the original stems, identifying key elements, and building upon them. His goal is to create a remix that not only pays homage to the original but also reflects his own musical style.

Nicholas explains how he selects and manipulates audio, uses MIDI synths, and layers the vocals. We talk about how he chose to focus on the chorus of "Rainy Day Friction," making it the centerpiece of his remix. Nicholas's remixing process also involves experimenting with various instruments and effects, creating a sound that is both contemporary and nostalgic, with influences from new wave and 60s orchestral music.

We also talk about the creative decision to add whispering vocals for a ghostly effect and balancing multiple instrument layers in the mix. 

Links

Nicholas Burgess Website https://nicholasburgess.com

Listen to the album!

Lorenzo's Remixes, Volume 1

Listen to the album

Jon Worthy - From Creative Commons to Full-Time Musician - Lorenzo's Music Podcast

October 11, 2024 by Tom Ray

Subscribe to the show on: Spotify | Apple Podcasts | YouTube Podcasts | RSS

In this episode of the Lorenzo's Music Podcast, I meet Jon Worthy, a Nashville-based Creative Commons musician. We talk about Jon's beginnings in a college band as a guitarist to becoming a full-time musician. Transitioning from traditional studio recordings to home recordings using tools like Ableton.

Jon also talks about new opportunities he's received over the years including sync licensing for TV shows like "American Ninja Warrior" and "Selling Sunset."

We also talk about releasing his music under Creative Commons license allowing his music to reach wider audiences and be featured in various multimedia projects, from short films to travel vlogs. 

The episode also touches on the challenges of touring, booking shows, his experiences organizing them, and the eventual decision to focus more on music production and less on constant touring. 

Jon recently released a new album, "Barely Here," which he successfully funded through a crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo. The album is available on vinyl, a medium Jon has long admired for its tangible, artistic appeal. 

Tune in to hear more about Jon Worthy's journey, and his creative process.

Links

Jon Worthy on YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/@jonworthy

Jon Worthy on Spotify - Jon Worthy Spotify Channel
